SEARCH
Package dao

Interface LuggageDAO

All Known Implementing Classes:
LuggageDAOImpl
public interface LuggageDAO
Data Access Object interface for managing luggage operations in the airport management system.

This interface defines the contract for all luggage-related database operations, providing methods for retrieving lost luggage information and managing luggage associations with bookings. It serves as the primary interface for luggage data persistence and retrieval operations, supporting both customer service functions and administrative luggage management tasks.

The LuggageDAO interface provides comprehensive luggage management capabilities including:

  • Retrieval of all lost luggage items across the system for recovery operations
  • Comprehensive luggage data retrieval including passenger and flight information
  • Booking-specific luggage retrieval for customer service and operational purposes
  • Integration with flight, booking, ticket, and passenger data systems

The interface follows the DAO pattern to provide a clean separation between business logic and data persistence layer, enabling different implementations for various database systems while maintaining consistent functionality across the application.

Since:
1.0

  • Method Details

    • getAllLostLuggages

      void getAllLostLuggages(List<String> flightIds, List<String> companyNames, List<Date> flightDates, List<Time> departureTimes, List<Time> arrivalTimes, List<String> flightStatus, List<Integer> maxSeats, List<Integer> freeSeats, List<String> cities, List<Boolean> flightTypes, List<Integer> buyerIds, List<String> usernames, List<String> mails, List<String> hashedPasswords, List<Date> bookingDates, List<String> bookingStatus, List<Integer> bookingIds, List<String> ticketNumbers, List<Integer> seats, List<Boolean> checkedIns, List<String> firstNames, List<String> lastNames, List<String> passengerSSNs, List<Date> birthDates, List<Integer> luggageIds, List<String> luggageTypes, List<String> luggageStatus, List<String> luggageIdsAfterCheckin) throws SQLException
      Retrieves comprehensive information about all lost luggage items in the system.

      This method performs a query to fetch complete information about all luggage items that have been reported as lost (luggage_status = 'LOST'). It provides a view of lost luggage including associated flight details, passenger information, booking data, and luggage specifications for recovery and customer service operations.

      The method joins multiple database tables (FLIGHT, BOOKING, TICKET, PASSENGER, LUGGAGE, CUSTOMER) to provide complete lost luggage information. All lists are populated with corresponding data at the same index positions, allowing for easy data correlation and processing.

      The retrieved data includes:

      • Complete flight information including schedules and airline details
      • Customer account information for notification and contact purposes
      • Booking details including status and creation timestamps
      • Ticket information with seat assignments and check-in status
      • Passenger personal information for identification and contact
      • Luggage specifications including type, status, and tracking identifiers
      Parameters:
      flightIds - list to be populated with flight identifiers
      companyNames - list to be populated with airline company names
      flightDates - list to be populated with flight dates derived from departure timestamps
      departureTimes - list to be populated with flight departure times
      arrivalTimes - list to be populated with flight arrival times
      flightStatus - list to be populated with current flight status values
      maxSeats - list to be populated with flight maximum seating capacity
      freeSeats - list to be populated with available seats count
      cities - list to be populated with destination or origin city names
      flightTypes - list to be populated with flight type indicators (true for departing, false for arriving)
      buyerIds - list to be populated with customer identifiers who made the bookings
      usernames - list to be populated with customer usernames
      mails - list to be populated with customer email addresses
      hashedPasswords - list to be populated with customer password hashes
      bookingDates - list to be populated with booking creation timestamps
      bookingStatus - list to be populated with booking status values
      bookingIds - list to be populated with unique booking identifiers
      ticketNumbers - list to be populated with ticket numbers
      seats - list to be populated with seat assignments (null if not assigned, 0-based indexing)
      checkedIns - list to be populated with check-in status indicators
      firstNames - list to be populated with passenger first names
      lastNames - list to be populated with passenger last names
      passengerSSNs - list to be populated with passenger SSN identifiers
      birthDates - list to be populated with passenger birth dates
      luggageIds - list to be populated with luggage identifiers (null if no luggage)
      luggageTypes - list to be populated with luggage type descriptions (CARRY_ON or CHECKED)
      luggageStatus - list to be populated with luggage status values (should be 'LOST')
      luggageIdsAfterCheckin - list to be populated with post-checkin luggage identifiers
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the data retrieval operation

    • getAllLuggagesOfBooking

      void getAllLuggagesOfBooking(Integer bookingId, List<String> ticketNumbers, List<Integer> luggageIds, List<String> luggageTypes, List<String> luggageStatus, List<String> luggageIdsAfterCheckin) throws SQLException
      Retrieves all luggage items associated with a specific booking.

      This method fetches comprehensive luggage information for all luggage items associated with a particular booking. It provides detailed luggage data including identification, type, status, and associated ticket information for customer service operations and booking management purposes.

      The method joins multiple database tables (BOOKING, TICKET, PASSENGER, LUGGAGE, CUSTOMER) to provide complete luggage information for the specified booking. All lists are populated with corresponding data at the same index positions, enabling easy correlation between luggage items and their associated tickets.

      The retrieved data includes:

      • Ticket numbers associated with each luggage item
      • Luggage database identifiers for system tracking
      • Post-checkin luggage identifiers for physical tracking
      • Luggage type classification (CARRY_ON or CHECKED)
      • Current luggage status throughout handling lifecycle
      Parameters:
      bookingId - the unique identifier of the booking to retrieve luggage for
      ticketNumbers - list to be populated with ticket numbers associated with each luggage item
      luggageIds - list to be populated with luggage database identifiers (null if not assigned)
      luggageTypes - list to be populated with luggage type descriptions (CARRY_ON or CHECKED)
      luggageStatus - list to be populated with luggage status values (BOOKED, LOADED, WITHDRAWABLE, LOST)
      luggageIdsAfterCheckin - list to be populated with post-checkin luggage identifiers for physical tracking
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs during the data retrieval operation

    • lostLuggage

      void lostLuggage(String ticket, String luggageStatus)
      Updates the status of a luggage item to indicate it has been lost.

      This method performs a luggage status update operation to mark luggage as lost using the post-checkin luggage identifier. It uses PostgreSQL's enum casting to ensure proper luggage status validation and data integrity.

      Parameters:
      ticket - the post-checkin luggage identifier used for physical tracking
      luggageStatus - the new luggage status to set (typically "LOST" but can be other valid status values)
